main.emotion: Tired and uneasy, burdened by uncertainty

emotional.opener: Nikola, it’s all right to feel unsettled. No one expects certainty right now—not with the ground shifting under everyone. You’ve carried a lot longer than most; a small breath of relief is allowed.
variants: I appreciate you saying that, Alex.
Some things are best left unspoken for now.

Trust isn’t given lightly, especially these days.
I still prefer caution.
You have a point. Nothing’s steady, and maybe it never was.
It helps to remember we’re all carrying something.
I just need to breathe, as you say.
Letting go isn’t easy but maybe it’s necessary.
You always find the right words, Alex. I suppose I have held onto too much, for too long.

Sometimes I wonder if caution is habit, not wisdom.

Back when the Council still meant something… it was easier to believe in purpose.
Now, I catch myself holding my breath, scanning every face. Old habits. Old scars.
Getting older, I see how much that weighs on a person.
Your words matter. I’ll try to remember them.
